snippet: In part because of wage stagnation, even smaller rises in health care costs are less affordable, a study by the Commonwealth Fund said.
abstract: Commonwealth Fund analyzes health care costs across states and finds workers with employee-sponsored health insurance are paying more for health care even as premium price increases have slowed; trend combined with stagnation of incomes results in heavier burden for workers.
lead_paragraph: In part because of wage stagnation, even smaller rises in health care costs are less affordable, a study by the Commonwealth Fund said.

headline.main: Health Premiums Rise More Slowly, but Workers Shoulder More of Cost
headline.print_headline: Health Premiums Rise More Slowly, but Workers Shoulder More of Cost

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
